function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Limited application of comprehensive data analysis methods for understanding disease spread and its impact on built environments.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of suitable environments for working from home leading to increased transmission of contagious diseases like covid-19.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate hygienic facilities and designs in homes leading to a higher risk of disease transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of digital risk monitoring and health reporting leading to undetected spread of contagious diseases in construction and work sites.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in work and leisure locations due to covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Focus on indoor environment quality and building materials","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rethinking of sustainability requirements for residential buildings","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Spread of contagious diseases due to prolonged lockdowns and close living conditions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of pandemic policies on housing sector and green buildings","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ecological fallacy risk due to population-weighted assessments","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of personal data on individuals infected by sars-cov-2","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertified research findings","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Correlational findings instead of causal findings","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Failure to consider other significant factors associated with infection rates","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Failure to account for the impact of vaccination programs on the relationship between green spaces and infection rates","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient control for socioeconomic, demographic, political, healthcare, testing, behavioral, and climate factors in previous studies may lead to unreliable findings.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Stationarity assumption in relationships between environmental factors and health outcomes has been criticized, indicating potential variability in the impact of green spaces on infection rates.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited ecological studies fail to reveal the nuanced relationship between green spaces and health outcomes, hindering the effectiveness of environmental interventions.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inconsistent sars-cov-2 testing among counties leading to underestimation of infection cases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Substantial underestimation of infection cases in some areas during the early stage of the pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduced infection risk associated with forest within walking distance","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Increased tree density associated with lower prevalence of early childhood asthma","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Challenges with social distancing in highly urbanized counties due to shared green spaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Weaker association between forest coverage and infection rate in rural counties due to private properties","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Reduced nk cell numbers observed during the acute phase of sars-cov-2 infection.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Forest as a more mentally restorative green space than other green spaces.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Forest may be more effective in removing ambient pollutants than other green spaces.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"More people choosing natural forest parks over urban parks during the covid-19 pandemic.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Tree canopies creating a more comfortable microclimate in forest areas.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Reported boost in immune function from forest therapy and exposure to phytoncides.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Ambient pollutants leading to increased infection risk from sars-cov-2","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of adherence to infection prevention measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Weaker stimulus for outdoor activities in non-forest green spaces","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Encouraging people to spend more time outdoors in green spaces may increase the risk of exposure to contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Promoting physical activities in green spaces may lead to increased social interaction and close proximity, potentially facilitating the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Enhanced social cohesion and cooperation in green spaces may result in larger gatherings and social events, increasing the potential for contagious disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of outdoor opportunities for recreation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Suppression of social interaction","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sars-cov-2 transmission via aerosol particles","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Association between forest exposure and infection rates","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Negative association between forest and infection rates","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Influence of urbanicity levels on forest-infection rate association","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impact of distance between forest and human settlements on infection rates","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Association between green space and infection rates","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Positive association of developed open space with infection rates","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Variations in green space-infection associations across levels of urbanicity","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Conducting multiple regression models may lead to the risk of overfitting and misleading results due to the large number of predictor variables.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Assessing the association of forest with infection rates across different time periods and urbanicity levels may overlook other important factors contributing to disease propagation.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Examining the optimal distance from forest for its association with infection rates may neglect the impact of other environmental and social determinants of health in disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Using satellite imagery data without proper validation or ground truthing","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"}]}
